pr_title: xds: precise logic for selecting the virtual host in RDS responses

timeline.message: Correct logic for choosing the right VirtualHost.

timeline.bodyText: If both a.example.com (exact matching) and *.example.com (suffix matching ) are in the list, then suffix matching will be finally selected if it comes later.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: Not sure about the spec. If the best matching targetVirtualHost doesn't satisfy this condition, but the rank 2 matching satisfies, still return null?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Hmm... That's very subtle edge case. It's not specified (and I guess this detail won't be specified precisely even in the future, as this detail is very deep in terms of implementation). But I think returning null would make more sense. Domain matching decides which virtual host to be routed to, if that virtual host is not configured correctly for gRPC, then returning null as for result not found will at least raise our attention if this causes failure. If we've ever hit such an edge case, discussions will be brought up. I think for now, we don't need to consider this too complicatedly.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: It may worth a comment to describe the behavior of our implementation or rationale of our choice for the edge case.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.message: Fix logic bug of domain matching. A domain name with ending asterisk takes over exact matching if appears after the exact matching domain and the asterisk matches a single character.
Add a note for subtle edge case of selected virtual host not correctly configured.
